verses.verse: When I would have healed <WH7495> Israel <WH3478>, then the iniquity <WH5771> of Ephraim <WH669> was discovered <WH1540>, and the wickedness <WH7451> of Samaria <WH8111>: for they commit <WH6466> falsehood <WH8267>; and the thief <WH1590> cometh in <WH935>, and the troop <WH1416> of robbers spoileth <WH6584> without <WH2351>. wickedness: Heb. evils spoileth: Heb. strippeth

And they consider <WH559> not in their hearts <WH3824> that I remember <WH2142> all their wickedness <WH7451>: now their own doings <WH4611> have beset them about <WH5437>; they are before my face <WH6440>. consider: Heb. say not to
They make the king <WH4428> glad <WH8055> with their wickedness <WH7451>, and the princes <WH8269> with their lies <WH3585>.

They are all adulterers <WH5003>, as an oven <WH8574> heated <WH1197> by the baker <WH644>, who ceaseth <WH7673> from raising <WH5782> after he hath kneaded <WH3888> the dough <WH1217>, until it be leavened <WH2556>. who: or, the raiser will cease raising: or, waking

In the day <WH3117> of our king <WH4428> the princes <WH8269> have made him sick <WH2470> with bottles <WH2534> of wine <WH3196>; he stretched out <WH4900> his hand <WH3027> with scorners <WH3945>. bottles: or, heat through wine

For they have made ready <WH7126> their heart <WH3820> like an oven <WH8574>, whiles they lie in wait <WH693>: their baker <WH644> sleepeth <WH3463> all the night <WH3915>; in the morning <WH1242> it burneth <WH1197> as a flaming <WH3852> fire <WH784>. made: or, applied
They are all hot <WH2552> as an oven <WH8574>, and have devoured <WH398> their judges <WH8199>; all their kings <WH4428> are fallen <WH5307>: there is none among them that calleth <WH7121> unto me.
Ephraim <WH669>, he hath mixed <WH1101> himself among the people <WH5971>; Ephraim <WH669> is a cake <WH5692> not turned <WH2015>.

Strangers <WH2114> have devoured <WH398> his strength <WH3581>, and he knoweth <WH3045> it not: yea, gray hairs <WH7872> are here and there <WH2236> upon him, yet he knoweth <WH3045> not. here: Heb. sprinkled
And the pride <WH1347> of Israel <WH3478> testifieth <WH6030> to his face <WH6440>: and they do not return <WH7725> to the LORD <WH3068> their God <WH430>, nor seek <WH1245> him for all this.
Ephraim <WH669> also is like a silly <WH6601> dove <WH3123> without heart <WH3820>: they call <WH7121> to Egypt <WH4714>, they go <WH1980> to Assyria <WH804>.

When they shall go <WH3212>, I will spread <WH6566> my net <WH7568> upon them; I will bring them down <WH3381> as the fowls <WH5775> of the heaven <WH8064>; I will chastise <WH3256> them, as their congregation <WH5712> hath heard <WH8088>.

Woe <WH188> unto them! for they have fled <WH5074> from me: destruction <WH7701> unto them! because they have transgressed <WH6586> against me: though I have redeemed <WH6299> them, yet they have spoken <WH1696> lies <WH3577> against me. destruction: Heb. spoil

And they have not cried <WH2199> unto me with their heart <WH3820>, when they howled <WH3213> upon their beds <WH4904>: they assemble <WH1481> themselves for corn <WH1715> and wine <WH8492>, and they rebel <WH5493> against me.
Though I have bound <WH3256> and strengthened <WH2388> their arms <WH2220>, yet do they imagine <WH2803> mischief <WH7451> against me. have: or, chastened

They return <WH7725>, but not to the most High <WH5920>: they are like a deceitful <WH7423> bow <WH7198>: their princes <WH8269> shall fall <WH5307> by the sword <WH2719> for the rage <WH2195> of their tongue <WH3956>: this <WH2097> shall be their derision <WH3933> in the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>.
